item.title: 📊 About Me
item.description:
I’m Aman, a Data Engineer & Data Scientist, currently pursuing my Master’s in Data Science at the University of San Francisco (USF).

I specialize in building scalable data pipelines, processing large-scale geospatial datasets, and applying machine learning to real-world data problems.

🛠️ Data Engineering #

  • Big Data Pipelines → Processing 100+ GB of satellite imagery weekly
  • Cloud & Storage → Experience with AWS, GCP, and on-prem data warehouses
  • Geospatial Data Processing → Automating geospatial ETL workflows for environmental monitoring
  • ETL Optimization → Reduced data latency by 40% through pipeline refactoring

📈 Data Science #

  • Machine Learning for Geospatial Data → Applying ML models to detect land use changes
  • Feature Engineering at Scale → Building data transformations that power predictive models
  • Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) → Extracting insights from multi-terabyte datasets
  • Time Series & Forecasting → Predicting trends in satellite imagery & geospatial metrics

⚡ Current Work #

  • Satellite Data Processing → Developing an end-to-end AI-powered geospatial pipeline for The Nature Conservancy
  • Debugging & Optimization at Scale → Previously worked on Meta’s data warehouse, improving SQL & ETL performance

📄 More About Me #

  • Download My Resume

  • LinkedIn

I enjoy solving tough data problems, optimizing ML pipelines, and engineering scalable solutions for massive datasets.
